subject: Re: Video Part 3 uploaded (5 researchers ITC audio files)
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Chad,

Thanks again for participating and for sending your files.
No, I didn't get everyone who I mailed debris to participate.  If 
they did do sessions, a couple didn't send any files to me.  One 
person is still planning to send some just so I can hear them.

I sent out 9 debris packages and got 5 sets of files in return... a 
good investment.

I need to listen to the files a few more times to see if there are 
things I may have missed.  When dealing with the Radio Shack hacks or 
Franks Box, there is so much information being put out of the 
speaker.  It's easy to miss something if you aren't really focused.
I heard your "the 20" reply very clear and I knew about the passenger 
count, so it was easy to relate the items quickly.

Yes, I got what I expected from all the files.  It was a good mixture 
of methods and the data is there for further review.
The instructions were followed pretty much, with a few files a bit 
longer than 30 seconds, so I used the shorter ones, but still have 
some of the longer ones for review too.

Would I do this again..??  Yes.. I think I would.  I really 
appreciated all the willingness of those who were interested.

Again... thanks for your help and thanks for your kind words!

- Mike C.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Chad" <cawiggins78@...> wrote:
>
> I am glad you finished the video Mike! I enjoyed getting to hear 
what
> everyone else sent in, as well as what your results were. I am 
curious
> as to whether or not you got full participation once you sent out 
the
> debris. Did everyone follow your instructions? Did you get files 
from
> everyone you send debris to? Did you get better or worse results 
than
> you expected? Would you attempt something like this again?
> 
> I was very excited to participate in the research and am planning on
> doing more with the debris in the future. Just wanted to 
say "thanks"
> and keep up the great work. I think your experiments and willingness
> to share your work are a shining example to all in the paranormal 
field.
> 
> I hope everyone enjoyed this as much as I did. I plan on doing a 
write
> up on our website about the experiment in the near future. I'd like 
to
> hear from the other researchers on their experience with this 
project...
>
